name: Switch with literals
prompt:
Add a public function called DayName to Calculator.calr that converts a day number (1-7) to a descriptive integer. It takes i32 parameter day and returns i32 (returns 100 for weekdays Mon-Fri, 200 for weekend Sat-Sun, 0 for invalid).

Use this exact Calor switch syntax:
§F{f003:DayName:pub}
  §I{i32:day}
  §O{i32}
  §R §W{w001} day
    §K 1 → 100
    §K 2 → 100
    §K 3 → 100
    §K 4 → 100
    §K 5 → 100
    §K 6 → 200
    §K 7 → 200
    §K _ → 0
  §/W{w001}
§/F{f003}

The §W{id} expr syntax creates a switch expression where:
- id is a unique switch identifier
- §K pattern → expr defines cases (the arrow automatically returns the expression)
- §K _ is the default/wildcard case
- §R §W{...} returns the result of the switch expression
